meanings.definition: To care for or look after
meanings.sent1: She tended to her garden every morning.
meanings.sent2: The nurse tended to the patient's wounds with care.
meanings.sent3: The cat tended to the mouse as if it were her own baby.
meanings.sent4: His kindness tended to everyone's needs like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter tended to the burning house, saving lives.

meanings.definition: To have a tendency or inclination
meanings.sent1: He tended to oversleep on weekends.
meanings.sent2: She tended to procrastinate when faced with difficult tasks.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tended to chew on shoes when left alone.
meanings.sent4: His mind tended to wander during long lectures.
meanings.sent5: The old clock tended to run fast, always ahead of time.

meanings.sent1: She tended to believe everything she heard.
meanings.sent2: He tended to avoid conflict in any situation.
meanings.sent3: The child tended to exaggerate the size of the fish he caught.
meanings.sent4: His taste tended to favor spicy foods over bland ones.
meanings.sent5: The artist tended to use bright colors in her paintings.
